Bitmap Export

More

× makes it easier for developers to use your Photoshop, Sketch, or Illustrator source file as a measurement spec because it matches the density independent pixel grid: a universal pixel grid shared by all devices to approximate consistent sizing regardless of pixel density.

Bitmap assets, including photos and other non-vector elements, should be exported for development at times the size they appear in your comp. For example, a 100 × 100 image in your comp would need to be cut as a × asset. If you use Sketch, this is easily managed by setting any objectâ€™s export size to x. If you use Photoshop for your screen comp, it might be helpful to link your high resolution bitmap assets as smart objects.

Best setup for Photoshop Retina and prototyping

Width

Height

More

If you use Photoshop with a Retina display and × is too small a design space, you can enlarge the canvas to × instead. This is also a practical comp size if you plan to make a lot of prototypes out of flattened screens.

Keep in mind that this size reflects physical device pixels, and not the density independent pixels used in code by developers. As a best practice, append @x to the PSD filename so that both designers and developers know they should divide by to get correct measurements.
